blocks.text:
As before
log sin A = log sin A + log sin B
log sin 55° 10′ + log sin 38° 16′ + log sin 44° 35′
1 : sin A = 47° 3′ : 132° 57′  
so that possible values of A are 47° 3′ and 132° 57′, and we must test each of these values.

Example 1: In a spherical triangle A = 30°, let B = 60°.
Given also:

A = 30°; B = 60°; C = 90°; A = 30°; B = 60°; C = 90°

Then from the table and included angle we; therefore use equations (8) and (9):

blocks.description: Using the tangent function for the angles and sides of the triangle.
Relating the tangent of angle A to tangent P.

blocks.text:
Taking logs of both sides: 

\[L = \tan A = \log(\tan A) - \log(\sin C)\\
\ L = \log A + \log B - \log C = \log A + \log B - \log A + \log B - \log A = A + B = 120° 8′ 6′′
\]
